summary: This document is a collection of FAA aircraft registration and security filings for a Gulfstream G550 (serial 5173) with tail numbers N212JE and N550GP. It includes an Aircraft Security Agreement dated May 11, 2021, between N550GP, LLC (Grantor) and Bank of Hope (Lender), securing a loan with the aircraft as collateral. The file traces the aircraft's ownership history from Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation to Chevron U.S.A. Inc., Plan D LLC, Six G Aviation LLC, and finally N550GP, LLC.

persons.name: Lawrence Visoski
persons.role: Manager of Plan D LLC and signatory
persons.context: Appears as the Manager signing aircraft registration renewal and transfer documents for Plan D LLC, the registered owner of the aircraft in 2017.

events.title: Aircraft Registration to Chevron
events.description: Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation sells the Gulfstream G550 (serial 5173) to Chevron U.S.A. Inc., registered as N401HB.

events.title: Aircraft Transfer to Plan D LLC
events.description: Chevron U.S.A. Inc. sells the aircraft to Plan D LLC, with the registration number changed from N415LM (assigned from N401HB) to N212JE.

events.title: Aircraft Transfer to Six G Aviation LLC and N550GP LLC
events.description: Plan D LLC sells the aircraft to Six G Aviation LLC, which then immediately sells it to N550GP, LLC on the same day.

events.title: Aircraft Security Agreement Executed
events.description: N550GP, LLC enters into an Aircraft Security Agreement with Bank of Hope, granting the bank a security interest in the aircraft to secure a loan.

events.title: Temporary Certificate of Registration for N550GP
events.description: FAA issues a temporary certificate of registration for N550GP, valid until August 21, 2021, following the assignment of the special registration number N550GP.

locations: Chino Airport (CNO) (Home Airport specified in security agreement)
St. Thomas, VI 00802 (address for Plan D LLC)
Oakland, CA (address for Chevron U.S.A. Inc.)
San Ramon, CA (address for Chevron U.S.A. Inc.)
Savannah, GA (address for Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation)
Los Angeles, CA (address for Bank of Hope)
keyFacts: The Gulfstream G550 (serial 5173) is the aircraft central to these documents, associated with Epstein through the tail number N550GP owned by N550GP, LLC.
The aircraft's ownership chain shows transfers from manufacturer Gulfstream to Chevron (2008), to Plan D LLC (2017), to Six G Aviation LLC, and finally to N550GP, LLC (2020).
On May 11, 2021, N550GP, LLC executed an Aircraft Security Agreement with Bank of Hope, using the aircraft as collateral for a loan, indicating financial activity involving the asset.
The file includes an Irrevocable De-Registration and Export Request Authorization (IDERA) in favor of Bank of Hope, giving the lender power to deregister and export the aircraft in case of default.
Multiple FAA forms show the aircraft's registration number changes: originally N673GA (manufacturer assignment), then N401HB (Chevron), N415LM, N212JE (Plan D LLC), and finally N550GP (N550GP, LLC).
